get.summary: List announcements

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return. Defaults to 10. Maximum allowed is 50.

parameters.name: page_num
parameters.description: Page number of the results to return. Defaults to the first page, 1.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: The field on which to order the result set. Defaults to released_at. Must be one of: released_at.

parameters.name: order_dir
parameters.description: Direction in which to sort, either asc (ascending) or desc (descending) defaulting to desc.

get.summary: List Aliases

parameters.name: object_type
parameters.description: Filter results by object type. Pass multiple object types with a comma-separatedlist. Valid types include: cass_ncoa, container_script, geocode, python_script, r_script, salesforce_export, javascript_script, sql_script, project, notebook, workflow, template_script, template_report, service, report, tableau and service_report.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return. Defaults to 50. Maximum allowed is 1000.

parameters.name: page_num
parameters.description: Page number of the results to return. Defaults to the first page, 1.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: The field on which to order the result set. Defaults to id. Must be one of: id, object_type.

parameters.name: order_dir
parameters.description: Direction in which to sort, either asc (ascending) or desc (descending) defaulting to asc.

get.summary: List Kubernetes Clusters

parameters.name: organization_slug
parameters.description: The slug of this cluster's organization.

parameters.name: raw_cluster_slug
parameters.description: The slug of this cluster's raw configuration.

parameters.name: exclude_inactive_orgs
parameters.description: When true, excludes KubeClusters associated with inactive orgs. Defaults to false.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return. Defaults to its maximum of 50.

parameters.name: page_num
parameters.description: Page number of the results to return. Defaults to the first page, 1.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: The field on which to order the result set. Defaults to organization_id. Must be one of: organization_id, created_at.

parameters.name: order_dir
parameters.description: Direction in which to sort, either asc (ascending) or desc (descending) defaulting to asc.

get.summary: List the deployments associated with a Kubernetes Cluster

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the cluster.

parameters.name: base_type
parameters.description: If specified, return deployments of these base types. It accepts a comma-separated list, possible values are 'Notebook', 'Service', 'Run'.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: If specified, return deployments in these states. It accepts a comma-separated list, possible values are pending, running, terminated, sleeping

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return. Defaults to its maximum of 50.

parameters.name: page_num
parameters.description: Page number of the results to return. Defaults to the first page, 1.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: The field on which to order the result set. Defaults to created_at. Must be one of: created_at.

parameters.name: order_dir
parameters.description: Direction in which to sort, either asc (ascending) or desc (descending) defaulting to asc.

get.summary: Get list of Credential Types
List credentials

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type (or types) of credentials to return. One or more of: Amazon Web Services S3, Bitbucket, CASS/NCOA PAF, Certificate, Civis Platform, Custom, Database, Google, Github, Salesforce User, Salesforce Client, and TableauUser. Specify multiple values as a comma-separated list (e.g., "A,B").

parameters.name: remote_host_id
parameters.description: The ID of the remote host associated with the credentials to return.

parameters.name: default
parameters.description: If true, will return a list with a single credential which is the current user's default credential.

parameters.name: system_credentials
parameters.description: If true, will only return system credentials. System credentials can only be created and viewed by Civis Admins.

parameters.name: users
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of user ids. If specified, returns set of credentials owned by the users that requesting user has at least read access on.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: If specified, will be used to filter the credentials returned. Will search across name and will return any full name containing the search string.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return. Defaults to its maximum of 1000.

parameters.name: page_num
parameters.description: Page number of the results to return. Defaults to the first page, 1.

Option: 'queue' means to queue a separate job for syncing stats and do not block this job on the queued job. Defaults to 'flag'

get.summary: List

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: If specified, return exports of these types. It accepts a comma-separated list, possible values are 'database' and 'gdoc'.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: If specified, returns export with one of these statuses. It accepts a comma-separated list, possible values are 'running', 'failed', 'succeeded', 'idle', 'scheduled'.

parameters.name: author
parameters.description: If specified, return items from any of these authors. It accepts a comma-separated list of user IDs.

parameters.name: hidden
parameters.description: If specified to be true, returns hidden items. Defaults to false, returning non-hidden items.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: The archival status of the requested item(s).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return. Defaults to 20. Maximum allowed is 50.

parameters.name: page_num
parameters.description: Page number of the results to return. Defaults to the first page, 1.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: The field on which to order the result set. Defaults to updated_at. Must be one of: updated_at, name, created_at, last_run.updated_at.

parameters.name: order_dir
parameters.description: Direction in which to sort, either asc (ascending) or desc (descending) defaulting to desc.

parameters.description: The field on which to order the result set. Defaults to repo_url. Must be one of: repo_url, created_at.

parameters.description: Direction in which to sort, either asc (ascending) or desc (descending) defaulting to asc.

get.summary: List Groups

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: If specified, it will filter the groups returned. Infix matching is supported (e.g., "query=group" will return "group" and "group of people" and "my group" and "my group of people").

parameters.name: permission
parameters.description: A permissions string, one of "read", "write", or "manage". Lists only groups for which the current user has that permission.

parameters.name: include_members
parameters.description: Show members of the group.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return. Defaults to 50. Maximum allowed is 1000.

parameters.name: page_num
parameters.description: Page number of the results to return. Defaults to the first page, 1.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: The field on which to order the result set. Defaults to name. Must be one of: name, created_at.

parameters.name: order_dir
parameters.description: Direction in which to sort, either asc (ascending) or desc (descending) defaulting to asc.

get.summary: List Imports

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: If specified, return imports of these types. It accepts a comma-separated list, possible values are 'AutoImport', 'DbSync', 'Salesforce', 'GdocImport'.

parameters.name: destination
parameters.description: If specified, returns imports with one of these destinations. It accepts a comma-separated list of remote host ids.

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: If specified, returns imports with one of these sources. It accepts a comma-separated list of remote host ids. 'DbSync' must be specified for 'type'.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: If specified, returns imports with one of these statuses. It accepts a comma-separated list, possible values are 'running', 'failed', 'succeeded', 'idle', 'scheduled'.

parameters.name: author
parameters.description: If specified, return items from any of these authors. It accepts a comma-separated list of user IDs.

parameters.name: hidden
parameters.description: If specified to be true, returns hidden items. Defaults to false, returning non-hidden items.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: The archival status of the requested item(s).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return. Defaults to 20. Maximum allowed is 50.

parameters.name: page_num
parameters.description: Page number of the results to return. Defaults to the first page, 1.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: The field on which to order the result set. Defaults to updated_at. Must be one of: updated_at, name, created_at, last_run.updated_at.

parameters.name: order_dir
parameters.description: Direction in which to sort, either asc (ascending) or desc (descending) defaulting to desc.

get.summary: List Jobs

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: The job's state. One or more of queued, running, succeeded, failed, and cancelled. Specify multiple values as a comma-separated list (e.g., "A,B").

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The job's type. Specify multiple values as a comma-separated list (e.g., "A,B").

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Query string to search on the id, name, and job type.

parameters.name: permission
parameters.description: A permissions string, one of "read", "write", or "manage". Lists only jobs for which the current user has that permission.

parameters.name: scheduled
parameters.description: If the item is scheduled.

parameters.name: hidden
parameters.description: If specified to be true, returns hidden items. Defaults to false, returning non-hidden items.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: The archival status of the requested item(s).

parameters.name: author
parameters.description: If specified, return items from any of these authors. It accepts a comma-separated list of user IDs.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return. Defaults to its maximum of 50.

parameters.name: page_num
parameters.description: Page number of the results to return. Defaults to the first page, 1.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: The field on which to order the result set. Defaults to updated_at. Must be one of: updated_at.

parameters.name: order_dir
parameters.description: Direction in which to sort, either asc (ascending) or desc (descending) defaulting to desc.

get.summary: List all available model types
List

parameters.name: model_name
parameters.description: If specified, will be used to filter the models returned. Substring matching is supported. (e.g., "modelName=model" will return both "model1" and "my model").

parameters.name: training_table_name
parameters.description: If specified, will be used to filter the models returned by the training dataset table name. Substring matching is supported. (e.g., "trainingTableName=table" will return both "table1" and "my_table").

parameters.name: dependent_variable
parameters.description: If specified, will be used to filter the models returned by the dependent variable column name. Substring matching is supported. (e.g., "dependentVariable=predictor" will return both "predictor" and "my predictor").

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: If specified, returns models with one of these statuses. It accepts a comma-separated list, possible values are 'running', 'failed', 'succeeded', 'idle', 'scheduled'.

parameters.name: author
parameters.description: If specified, return items from any of these authors. It accepts a comma-separated list of user IDs.

parameters.name: hidden
parameters.description: If specified to be true, returns hidden items. Defaults to false, returning non-hidden items.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: The archival status of the requested item(s).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return. Defaults to its maximum of 50.

parameters.name: page_num
parameters.description: Page number of the results to return. Defaults to the first page, 1.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: The field on which to order the result set. Defaults to updated_at. Must be one of: updated_at, name, created_at, last_run.updated_at.

parameters.name: order_dir
parameters.description: Direction in which to sort, either asc (ascending) or desc (descending) defaulting to desc.

get.summary: Show the prediction schedule

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the prediction associated with this schedule.

get.summary: List projects

parameters.name: permission
parameters.description: A permissions string, one of "read", "write", or "manage". Lists only projects for which the current user has that permission.

parameters.name: author
parameters.description: If specified, return items from any of these authors. It accepts a comma-separated list of user IDs.

parameters.name: hidden
parameters.description: If specified to be true, returns hidden items. Defaults to false, returning non-hidden items.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: The archival status of the requested item(s).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return. Defaults to 20. Maximum allowed is 1000.

parameters.name: page_num
parameters.description: Page number of the results to return. Defaults to the first page, 1.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: The field on which to order the result set. Defaults to updated_at. Must be one of: updated_at, name, created_at.

parameters.name: order_dir
parameters.description: Direction in which to sort, either asc (ascending) or desc (descending) defaulting to desc.

parameters.description: The database ID.

parameters.name: credential_id
parameters.description: The credential ID.

parameters.name: author_id
parameters.description: The author of the query.

parameters.name: created_before
parameters.description: An upper bound for the creation date of the query.

parameters.name: created_after
parameters.description: A lower bound for the creation date of the query.

parameters.name: started_before
parameters.description: An upper bound for the start date of the last run.

parameters.name: started_after
parameters.description: A lower bound for the start date of the last run.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: The state of the last run. One or more of queued, running, succeeded, failed, and cancelled. Specify multiple values as a comma-separated list (e.g., "A,B").

parameters.name: exclude_results
parameters.description: If true, does not return cached query results.

parameters.name: hidden
parameters.description: If specified to be true, returns hidden items. Defaults to false, returning non-hidden items.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: The archival status of the requested item(s).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return. Defaults to 20. Maximum allowed is 50.

parameters.name: page_num
parameters.description: Page number of the results to return. Defaults to the first page, 1.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: The field on which to order the result set. Defaults to created_at. Must be one of: created_at, started_at.

parameters.name: order_dir
parameters.description: Direction in which to sort, either asc (ascending) or desc (descending) defaulting to desc.

parameters.description: Direction in which to sort, either asc (ascending) or desc (descending) defaulting to desc.

get.summary: List Scripts

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: If specified, return items of these types. The valid types are sql, python3, javascript, r, and containers.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: A job category for filtering scripts. Must be one of script, import, export, and enhancement.

parameters.name: author
parameters.description: If specified, return items from any of these authors. It accepts a comma-separated list of user IDs.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: If specified, returns items with one of these statuses. It accepts a comma-separated list, possible values are 'running', 'failed', 'succeeded', 'idle', 'scheduled'.

parameters.name: hidden
parameters.description: If specified to be true, returns hidden items. Defaults to false, returning non-hidden items.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: The archival status of the requested item(s).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return. Defaults to 20. Maximum allowed is 50.

parameters.name: page_num
parameters.description: Page number of the results to return. Defaults to the first page, 1.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: The field on which to order the result set. Defaults to updated_at. Must be one of: updated_at, name, created_at, last_run.updated_at.

parameters.name: order_dir
parameters.description: Direction in which to sort, either asc (ascending) or desc (descending) defaulting to desc.

get.summary: List Custom Scripts

parameters.name: from_template_id
parameters.description: If specified, return scripts based on the template with this ID. Specify multiple IDs as a comma-separated list.

parameters.name: author
parameters.description: If specified, return items from any of these authors. It accepts a comma-separated list of user IDs.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: If specified, returns items with one of these statuses. It accepts a comma-separated list, possible values are 'running', 'failed', 'succeeded', 'idle', 'scheduled'.

parameters.name: hidden
parameters.description: If specified to be true, returns hidden items. Defaults to false, returning non-hidden items.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: The archival status of the requested item(s).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return. Defaults to its maximum of 50.

parameters.name: page_num

get.summary: Perform a search

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The search query.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type for the search. It accepts a comma-separated list. Valid arguments are listed on the "GET /search/types" endpoint.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset for the search results.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: The field on which to order the result set.

parameters.name: owner
parameters.description: The owner for the search.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Defaults to 10. Maximum allowed is 1000.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: If specified, return only results with the chosen archived status; either 'true', 'false', or 'all'. Defaults to 'false'.

parameters.name: last_run_state
parameters.description: The last run state of the job being searched for; either: 'queued', 'running', 'succeeded', 'failed', or 'cancelled'.

get.summary: List available search types
Search queries that are not hidden

parameters.name: search_string
parameters.description: Space delimited search terms for searching queries by their SQL. Supports wild card characters "?" for any single character, and "*" for zero or more characters.

parameters.name: database_id
parameters.description: The database ID.

parameters.name: credential_id
parameters.description: The credential ID.

parameters.name: author_id
parameters.description: The author of the query.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: The archival status of the requested item(s). Defaults to false.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: The state of the last run. One or more of queued, running, succeeded, failed, and cancelled.

parameters.name: started_before
parameters.description: An upper bound for the start date of the last run.

parameters.name: started_after
parameters.description: A lower bound for the start date of the last run.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return. Defaults to 10. Maximum allowed is 1000.

parameters.name: page_num
parameters.description: Page number of the results to return. Defaults to the first page, 1.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: The field on which to order the result set. Defaults to last_run_started_at. Must be one of: last_run_started_at.

parameters.name: order_dir
parameters.description: Direction in which to sort, either asc (ascending) or desc (descending) defaulting to desc.

get.summary: List Services

parameters.name: hidden
parameters.description: If specified to be true, returns hidden items. Defaults to false, returning non-hidden items.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: The archival status of the requested item(s).

parameters.name: author
parameters.description: If specified, return items from any of these authors. It accepts a comma-separated list of user IDs.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: If specified, returns Services with one of these statuses. It accepts a comma-separated list, possible values are 'running', 'idle'.

parameters.name: limit

post.summary: Creates and enqueues a single table scanner job on a new table

parameters.name: databaseId
parameters.description: The ID of the database.

parameters.name: schema
parameters.description: The name of the schema containing the table.

parameters.name: tableName
parameters.description: The name of the table.

parameters.name: statsPriority
parameters.description: When to sync table statistics. Valid Options are the following. Option: 'flag' means to flag stats for the next scheduled run of a full table scan on the database. Option: 'block' means to block this job on stats syncing. Option: 'queue' means to queue a separate job for syncing stats and do not block this job on the queued job. Defaults to 'flag'

get.summary: List tables

parameters.name: database_id
parameters.description: The ID of the database.

parameters.name: schema
parameters.description: If specified, will be used to filter the tables returned. Substring matching is supported with "%" and "*" wildcards (e.g., "schema=%census%" will return both "client_census.table" and "census_2010.table").

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: If specified, will be used to filter the tables returned. Substring matching is supported with "%" and "*" wildcards (e.g., "name=%table%" will return both "table1" and "my table").

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: If specified, will be used to filter the tables returned. Will search across schema and name (in the full form schema.name) and will return any full name containing the search string.

parameters.name: table_tag_ids
parameters.description: If specified, will be used to filter the tables returned. Will search across Table Tags and will return any tables that have one of the matching Table Tags.

parameters.name: credential_id
parameters.description: If specified, will be used instead of the default credential to filter the tables returned.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return. Defaults to 50. Maximum allowed is 1000.

parameters.name: page_num
parameters.description: Page number of the results to return. Defaults to the first page, 1.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: The field on which to order the result set. Defaults to schema. Must be one of: schema, name, search, table_tag_ids, credential_id.

parameters.name: order_dir
parameters.description: Direction in which to sort, either asc (ascending) or desc (descending) defaulting to asc.

get.summary: List users

parameters.name: feature_flag
parameters.description: Return users that have a feature flag enabled.

parameters.name: account_status
parameters.description: The account status by which to filter users. May be one of "active", "inactive", or "all". Defaults to active.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Return users who match the given query, based on name, user, email, and id.

parameters.name: group_id
parameters.description: The ID of the group by which to filter users. Cannot be present if group_ids is.

parameters.name: group_ids
parameters.description: The IDs of the groups by which to filter users. Cannot be present if group_id is.

parameters.name: organization_id
parameters.description: The ID of the organization by which to filter users.

parameters.name: exclude_groups
parameters.description: Whether or to exclude users' groups. Default: false.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return. Defaults to 20. Maximum allowed is 10000.

parameters.name: page_num
parameters.description: Page number of the results to return. Defaults to the first page, 1.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: The field on which to order the result set. Defaults to name. Must be one of: name, user.

parameters.name: order_dir
parameters.description: Direction in which to sort, either asc (ascending) or desc (descending) defaulting to asc.

parameters.name: object_type
parameters.description: The type of the object that is favorited. Valid options: Project

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return. Defaults to 50. Maximum allowed is 1000.

parameters.name: page_num
parameters.description: Page number of the results to return. Defaults to the first page, 1.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: The field on which to order the result set. Defaults to created_at. Must be one of: created_at, object_type, object_id.

parameters.name: order_dir
parameters.description: Direction in which to sort, either asc (ascending) or desc (descending) defaulting to desc.

get.summary: List Workflows

parameters.name: hidden
parameters.description: If specified to be true, returns hidden items. Defaults to false, returning non-hidden items.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: The archival status of the requested item(s).

parameters.name: author
parameters.description: If specified, return items from any of these authors. It accepts a comma-separated list of user IDs.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: State of the most recent execution.One or more of queued, running, succeeded, failed, cancelled, idle, and scheduled.

parameters.name: scheduled
parameters.description: If the workflow is scheduled.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return. Defaults to 20. Maximum allowed is 50.

parameters.name: page_num
parameters.description: Page number of the results to return. Defaults to the first page, 1.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: The field on which to order the result set. Defaults to updated_at. Must be one of: updated_at, name, created_at.

parameters.name: order_dir
parameters.description: Direction in which to sort, either asc (ascending) or desc (descending) defaulting to desc.

The name of the schema.

statsPriority.description: When to sync table statistics for every table in the schema. Valid options are the following. Option: 'flag' means to flag stats for the next scheduled run of a full table scan on the database. Option: 'block' means to block this job on stats syncing. Option: 'queue' means to queue a separate job for syncing stats and do not block this job on the queued job. Defaults to 'flag'

Set to "appendwksht" if you want to append to the end of an existing worksheet inside an existing spreadsheet. Default is set to "newsprsht"

diststyle.description: The diststyle to use for the table. One of "even", "all", or "key".

firstRowIsHeader.description: A boolean value indicating whether or not the first row is a header row. If first_row_is_header is null or omitted, it will be auto-detected.

multipart.description: If true, the upload URI will require a `multipart/form-data` POST request. Defaults to false.

escaped.description: If true, escape quotes with a backslash; otherwise, escape quotes by double-quoting. Defaults to false.

uploadUri.description: The URI which may be used to upload a tabular file for import. You must use this URI to upload the file you wish imported and then inform the Civis API when your upload is complete using the URI given by the runUri field of this response.

runUri.description: The URI to POST to once the file upload is complete. After uploading the file using the URI given in the uploadUri attribute of the response, POST to this URI to initiate the import of your uploaded file into the platform.

uploadFields.description: If multipart was set to true, these fields should be included in the multipart upload.

state.description: The state of the run, one of 'queued' 'running' 'succeeded' 'failed' or 'cancelled'.

isCancelRequested.description: True if run cancel requested, else false.

startedAt.description: The time the last run started at.

finishedAt.description: The time the last run completed.

error.description: The error, if any, returned by the run.

storageHostId.description: The ID of the source storage host.

credentialId.description: The ID of the credentials for the source storage host.

filePaths.description: The file or directory path(s) within the bucket from which to import.  E.g. the file_path for "s3://mybucket/files/all/" would be "/files/all/"If specifying a directory path, the job will import every file found under that path. All files must have the same column layout and file format (e.g., compression, columnDelimiter, etc.).

fileIds.description: The file ID(s) to import, if importing Civis file(s).

storagePath.description: The storage host file path to import, if importing files from an external storage provider (ex. S3).

schema.description: The destination schema name.

remoteHostId.description: The ID of the destination database host.

credentialId.description: The ID of the credentials for the destination database.

primaryKeys.description: A list of column(s) which together uniquely identify a row in the destination table.These columns must not contain NULL values. If the import mode is "upsert", this field is required;see the Civis Helpdesk article on "Advanced CSV Imports via the Civis API" for more information.

lastModifiedKeys.description: A list of the columns indicating a record has been updated.If the destination table does not exist, and the import mode is "upsert", this field is required.

sqlType.description: The SQL type of the column.

diststyle.description: The diststyle to use for the table. One of "even", "all", or "key".

distkey.description: Distkey for this table in Redshift

sortkeys.description: Sortkeys for this table in Redshift. Please provide a maximum of two.

source.description: The source file(s). Provide either an array of Civis file_ids or a storage path hash with an array of one or more file_paths.

firstRowIsHeader.description: A boolean value indicating whether or not the first row of the source file is a header row.

columnDelimiter.description: The column delimiter for the file. Valid arguments are "comma", "tab", and "pipe". Defaults to "comma".

escaped.description: A boolean value indicating whether or not the source file has quotes escaped with a backslash.Defaults to false.

compression.description: The type of compression of the source file. Valid arguments are "gzip" and "none". Defaults to "none".

existingTableRows.description: The behavior if a destination table with the requested name already exists.  One of "fail", "truncate", "append", "drop", or "upsert".Defaults to "fail".

maxErrors.description: The maximum number of rows with errors to ignore before failing. This option is not supported for Postgres databases.

tableColumns.description: An array of hashes corresponding to the columns in the order they appear in the source file. Each hash should have keys for database column "name" and "sqlType".This parameter is required if the table does not exist, the table is being dropped, or the columns in the source file do not appear in the same order as in the destination table.The "sqlType" key is not required when appending to an existing table.

loosenTypes.description: If true, SQL types with precisions/lengths will have these values increased to accommodate data growth in future loads. Type loosening only occurs on table creation. Defaults to false.

execution.description: In upsert mode, controls the movement of data in upsert mode. If set to "delayed", the data will be moved after a brief delay. If set to "immediate", the data will be moved immediately. In non-upsert modes, controls the speed at which detailed column stats appear in the data catalogue. Defaults to "delayed", to accommodate concurrent upserts to the same table and speedier non-upsert imports.

redshiftDestinationOptions.description: Additional options for imports whose destination is a Redshift table.

hidden.description: The hidden status of the item.

storageHostId.description: The ID of the source storage host.

credentialId.description: The ID of the credentials for the source storage host.

filePaths.description: The file or directory path(s) within the bucket from which to import.  E.g. the file_path for "s3://mybucket/files/all/" would be "/files/all/"If specifying a directory path, the job will import every file found under that path. All files must have the same column layout and file format (e.g., compression, columnDelimiter, etc.).

fileIds.description: The file ID(s) to import, if importing Civis file(s).

storagePath.description: The storage host file path to import, if importing files from an external storage provider (ex. S3).

schema.description: The destination schema name.

remoteHostId.description: The ID of the destination database host.

credentialId.description: The ID of the credentials for the destination database.

primaryKeys.description: A list of column(s) which together uniquely identify a row in the destination table.These columns must not contain NULL values. If the import mode is "upsert", this field is required;see the Civis Helpdesk article on "Advanced CSV Imports via the Civis API" for more information.

lastModifiedKeys.description: A list of the columns indicating a record has been updated.If the destination table does not exist, and the import mode is "upsert", this field is required.

sqlType.description: The SQL type of the column.

diststyle.description: The diststyle to use for the table. One of "even", "all", or "key".

distkey.description: Distkey for this table in Redshift

sortkeys.description: Sortkeys for this table in Redshift. Please provide a maximum of two.

source.description: The source file(s). Provide either an array of Civis file_ids or a storage path hash with an array of one or more file_paths.

firstRowIsHeader.description: A boolean value indicating whether or not the first row of the source file is a header row.

columnDelimiter.description: The column delimiter for the file. Valid arguments are "comma", "tab", and "pipe". Defaults to "comma".

escaped.description: A boolean value indicating whether or not the source file has quotes escaped with a backslash.Defaults to false.

compression.description: The type of compression of the source file. Valid arguments are "gzip" and "none". Defaults to "none".

existingTableRows.description: The behavior if a destination table with the requested name already exists.  One of "fail", "truncate", "append", "drop", or "upsert".Defaults to "fail".

maxErrors.description: The maximum number of rows with errors to ignore before failing. This option is not supported for Postgres databases.

tableColumns.description: An array of hashes corresponding to the columns in the order they appear in the source file. Each hash should have keys for database column "name" and "sqlType".This parameter is required if the table does not exist, the table is being dropped, or the columns in the source file do not appear in the same order as in the destination table.The "sqlType" key is not required when appending to an existing table.

loosenTypes.description: If true, SQL types with precisions/lengths will have these values increased to accommodate data growth in future loads. Type loosening only occurs on table creation. Defaults to false.

execution.description: In upsert mode, controls the movement of data in upsert mode. If set to "delayed", the data will be moved after a brief delay. If set to "immediate", the data will be moved immediately. In non-upsert modes, controls the speed at which detailed column stats appear in the data catalogue. Defaults to "delayed", to accommodate concurrent upserts to the same table and speedier non-upsert imports.

redshiftDestinationOptions.description: Additional options for imports whose destination is a Redshift table.

hidden.description: The hidden status of the item.
